properties.areaDesc: Lawrence, IN; Jackson, IN; Washington, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 10:46PM EST until February 16 at 8:12PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...


.The flood threat continues on the Wabash, White, and East Fork
White Rivers as a result of recent precipitation events, the
greatest of which brought up to about 2 inches of liquid or liquid
equivalent.

Flooding on the lower reaches of the Wabash and White Rivers is
expected to last as late as Sunday, February 23.  On the East Fork
White river flooding will run as late as Wednesday, February 19.

Flood impacts should mainly be confined to roads near the waterways,
agricultural land, bottomlands, and levees.  Please see the specific
impacts listed for your location of interest below or by going to
the web page described below.

The Flood Warning continues for
The East Fork White River at Seymour.
* until Sunday evening.
* At  9:45 PM Thursday the stage was 15.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 15.7 feet by late tonight then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Sunday morning.
* At 15.6 feet...Jackson County Sheriff's reported following roads
closed when the river experienced a minor rise after the Great June
2008 flood:  SR 235 east of Medora to Covered Bridge, CR 300N east
of Honeytown to Shieldstown, CR 225W between CR 300N and Slab Road
River Bridge, CR 410W from US 50 to Vallonia, Newford Road, west
from Vehslage Road to the 5000 block east, CR 400E from Newford
Road south to Shieldstown, CR 150 E from CR 3000N to CR 4000N, CR
100E from CR 3000N to CR 4000N and CR 700E by CR 800N.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
